thread.title: MPs to debate 'English votes for English laws' plans | Border
thread.title_full: MPs to debate 'English votes for English laws' plans | Border - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: MPs to debate 'English votes for English laws' plans | Border
text:
Westminster Credit: PA Members of Parliament will today debate plans to give English MPs an effective veto over laws that only affect England.
Under current legislation, MPs from Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland can vote on any motion in Westminster, but English MPs have no say on powers that have been devolved to their respective legislative assemblies.
The issue is famously referred to as 'the West Lothian question', after Labour MP for West Lothian, Tam Dalyell, repeatedly raised the question in the House of Commons.
The issue has recently intensified given the meteoric rise of the SNP, the Scottish independence referendum and a further increase of devolved powers to Holyrood.
The proposed reforms would include a 'grand committee', whereby English MPs would be able to scrutinise bills without any involvement from MPs from other nations.
English MPs would effectively be able to veto any legislation before it went to vote. However, any vote int he bill's final readings would include MPs from across the United Kingdom.
Last updated Thu 22 Oct 2015 Politics Scotland Cumbria Dumfries and Galloway Scottish Borders
